org.midica.midi

Class MidiListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.midica.midi.MidiListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.sound.midi.MetaEventListener

    public class MidiListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.sound.midi.MetaEventListener

    This class is used as a meta event listener for a playing MIDI sequence. An object of this class is provided to the sequencer. If a meta event occurs in the MIDI sequence, this listener is triggered.

    This is especially important for self-made meta events that are used to inform us about note-on or note-off events. If those events occur, the widgets in the player are updated accordingly.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

    • Method Detail

      • meta

        public void meta(javax.sound.midi.MetaMessage msg)

        This method is called if a meta event in the MIDI stream is detected. It determines the exact event type and informs the PlayerController and the MidiDevices about the changes.

        Specified by:
        meta in interface javax.sound.midi.MetaEventListener
